{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents mention that antibiotics can enhance the anticoagulant effect of coumarins. This is because some antibiotics can reduce the amount of the normal bacterial flora in the bowel, which make significant quantities of vitamin K1, thus potentiating the effect of warfarin. Therefore, the anticoagulant action is increased, not reduced. The mechanism is not related to decreased renal excretion of the anticoagulant, but rather to the reduction of vitamin K sources.", "answer_choice": "C"}
